framework.name: Pillar I:  Availability and Access to Basic and Social Services
framework.description:
Improved, equitable, inclusive, and safe access to quality basic services.
Lead organizations: UNICEF, UNHABITAT

children.name: Outcome 1: Improved, equitable, inclusive, and safe access to quality basic services.
Output 1.1. Enhancing access to quality formal and non-formal education services, including rehabilitation, equipment to ensure facilities are functional, safe roads to schools and building skills of

Output 1.2. Enhancing access to quality formal and community-based health and nutrition services, including establishment, rehabilitation, equipment to ensure facilities are functional and service pro
Output 1.3: Increasing access to improved water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) systems and services
Output 1.4: Increasing access to civil infrastructure and housing for increased resilience and security

framework.name: Pillar II:  Sustainable Socio-economic Recovery
framework.description:
Better access for people, especially the most vulnerable, to social protection services, sustainable livelihoods, and inclusive and equitable socio-economic recovery.
Lead organizations: UNDP, WFP

children.name: Outcome 2:  Better access for people, especially the most vulnerable, to social protection services, sustainable livelihoods, and inclusive and equitable socio-economic recovery.
Output 2.1: Enhancing access to sustainable incomes and decent employment opportunities
Output 2.2: Supporting social protection systems to ensure vulnerable populations have access to social assistance, services, and insurance
Output 2.3: Supporting the protection and restoration of natural resources, productive infrastructure, and assets for sustainable food production

framework.name: Pillar III:   Enabling environment for a resilient return
framework.description:
Improved living conditions of displaced people, returning refugees and affected communities.
Lead organizations: UNHCR, UNRWA

children.name: Outcome 3:  Improved living conditions of displaced people, returning refugees and affected communities.

Output 3.1: Supporting the capacities of government institutions and of returnees and affected communities, in particular vulnerable groups to ensure the provision of and access to legal and administr
Output 3.2: Enhancing access to enable the provision of basic and protection services and reintegration support to returnees and receiving communites.

Output 3.3: Strengthing the capacities of government institutions at all administrative levels and partners on collecting and analysing disaggregated population data (on displacement, return and reint
Output 3.4: Enhancing the safety and dignity of voluntary returns through technical advice on policies and legislation ,and facilitating procedures and measures for their implementation.

framework.name: Pillar IV:  People resilience and institutional responsiveness
framework.description:
Vulnerable groups’ resilience is enhanced through increased institutional responsiveness in planning and providing services
Lead organizations: UNFPA, UNDP

children.name: Outcome 4:  Vulnerable groups’ resilience is enhanced through increased institutional responsiveness in planning and providing services
Output 4.1: Enhancing the technical and institutional capacities to plan and design responsive, evidence-based, quality, and inclusive services that improve participation and resilience of people and
Output 4.2: Supporting the establishment of responsive, participatory effective, and accountable local governance system to support resilience recovery and SDGs localization
Output 4.3: Integrating right-based, inclusive, gender equality, protection and social cohesion for community resilience and well-being of vulnerable groups

framework.name: T-Pillar: Transitions Programme/Project/Activity not fit under the 4 Pillars
framework.description: Transitions Programme/Project/Activity not fit under the 4 Pillars

children.name: T-Pillar5 Outcome
children.description: Provision of legal assistance and awareness-raising on relevant legal and administrative matters (civil registration/documentation; amnesties; housing, land and property etc.) and strengthen community outreach and feedback mechanisms.

children.name: T-Pillar5 Output
Output 5.2: Specialized technical expertise injection to support national institutions
children.description: Injection of targeted capacity through the deployment of technical expertise to national institutions in order to maintain essential services, strengthen governance, and transfer skills in order to achieve sustainable performance.
